response.answer_text: Taken literally, accepting the agreed upon meaning of each of the symbols in that equation, 8 +8 = 4 is false. As others have said, if you make some weird assumptions (weird in my view) you can pound together some way it could, possibly, remotely be true but I reject those given in the other answers, given so far. One person said that if the 8s represent cups and the 4 represent quarts, 16 cups would equal 4 quarts : 8 cups + 8 cups = 4 quarts Sure, if you want to make things up the equation could be made to be true. Another provided answer is that 8 + 8 = 16 and so that means 4pm. Nope - times in 2400 hour notation are always stated with 4 digits - 1600, 1831, 0030, 0358, etc. In order to be clear, the time must be specified in four digits. If I saw a time stated as 16, I could assume it was 0016 (16 minutes past midnight) or I could assume it meant 1600 but I would not any assumption and I would question the time and see if I could get some confirmation of what is actually meant by the 16. Also, if you are assuming hours, this equation still doesn’t make sense. 8 hours + 8 hours = 16 hours. Sixteen hours is a number of hours, not a time. You might write it as 0800 (in 24 hour time notation) + 8 hours = 1600 (in 24 hour times notion) that is, as a number of hours added to a time, but you didn’t write it like that. You did not specify any units in the equation. The 8s and the 4 are stated simply as numbers, not as number of units of some measure. Even if you suppose that the numbers in the equation were in some number base system under than decimal, say hexadecimal, there’s no way to make the equation true. In hexadecimal, the numbers would be the same and the equation would still be false. In binary - well, you can’t use binary because the only digits in binary are 0 and 1 so you can’t even write the equation using 8s and 4. If you convert to binary, in an attempt to prove the equation true, you would get 1000 + 1000 = 100 which is also false. Base 8, called octal, doesn’t help because there is no 8 in the octal system. The digits in octal or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7. Even if you wrote it as 10 (decimal eight in Octal) + 10 it would not equal 4. It would equal 20 which in decimal is 16 and in hexadecimal it is F5 So, given what you provided, there is no way that 8 + 8 can equal 4. You are asking an arithmetic question and we can only perform the calculation as you show it and the result is that the equation is false. If you want to qualify the equations with units of measurement - say cups and quarts, then the equation could be true but as stated, the equation is false. Making some assumptions (most of which would be weird) violates all tenants of logic in that when working with such an equation, you must use what you have and nothing more. I don’t assume anything that I can back up with other, clear examples. I would reject the equation until someone either provided more information or agreed that it could not be true. As a programmer, I make any assumptions that I can validate with other, clear, examples. As stated, your equation cannot be true.
